sentence.Network_en: I guessed, by his preparations, that egress was allowed, and, leaving my hard couch , made a movement to follow him.
sentence.Network_cn: 看他作的准备, 我猜他允许我走了, 我离开我的硬座, 打算跟他走.

sentence.Network_en: Safe access and egress can be achieved by various methods.
sentence.Network_cn: 可以采用各种方法安全的进入或离开。

sentence.Network_en: Prevents egress of the latter through the unsealed portion.
sentence.Network_cn: 阻止后者通过未接合部分出来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin egressus 'gone out', from the verb egredi, from ex- 'out' + gradi 'to step'

means.word_mean: 1. (astronomy) the reappearance of a celestial body after an eclipse

sentences.sentence: "not a day's difference between the emergence of the andrenas and the opening of the willow catkins"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of coming (or going) out; becoming apparent

sentences.sentence: "Water issued from the hole in the wall"
"The words seemed to come out by themselves"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 侵略的,好斗的,有进取心的,敢作敢为的
stems_affixes.word_buile: aggress[v.侵略,进攻]+ive……的→adj.侵略的,好斗的,有进取心的,敢作敢为的
progress[n.进步]+ive……的→adj.进步的,先进的;前进的
ag再+gress走+ion表名词→一再往前走→进攻

stems_affixes.value_cn: [代表]大会;[美国等国的]国会,议会
stems_affixes.word_buile: con一起+gress行走,步→走到一起→代表大会
de分开+gree=gress行走,步→分开走→级别→程度,度数

stems_affixes.word_buile: digress[v.离题]+ion表名词→n.离题, 脱轨, 扯到枝节上
